analyzed: bdag nyid kyis myong bas bden na /
translated: The fact that the phenomena of the object of apprehension are manifest is true because they are experienced by themselves.

original: de yang shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is the object of cognition,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: but it is not the definition of cognition.

original: de yang ma rigs te /
analyzed: de yang ma rigs te /
translated: This is also unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid so sor nges pa nyams su myong na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid so sor nges pa nyams su myong na /
translated: Because when the nature of clarity is experienced as distinct,

original: sngon po la sogs pa so sor nyams su myong ba grub kyi /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa so sor nyams su myong ba grub kyi /
translated: the experience of individual things such as blue is established.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu stong snyed tshogs par gyur kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu stong snyed tshogs par gyur kyang ma yin no //
translated: But apart from that, even if a multitude of causes were to assemble, it would not be so.

original: de bas na 'di tha dad par 'jog par byed pa dang / rgyu'i tshogs kyi mthar thug pa yin pas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di tha dad par 'jog par byed pa dang / rgyu'i tshogs kyi mthar thug pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is what distinguishes them and is the ultimate collection of causes,

original: myong bar byed pa'i byed pa po yin pa nyid de /üîΩ'dis shes par byed pas shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: myong bar byed pa'i byed pa po yin pa nyid de / 'dis shes par byed pas shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: it is the experiencer.üîΩBecause it causes cognition, it is called cognition.

original: 'di nyid rig cing shes pa'i ngo bo yin pas shes pa yin par rigs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid rig cing shes pa'i ngo bo yin pas shes pa yin par rigs so //
translated: Or because it itself has the nature of awareness and cognition, it is reasonable that it is cognition.

original: de gnyi gas chos thams cad shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bor grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi gas chos thams cad shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bor grub pa yin te /
translated: Both of those establish that all phenomena are the nature of cognition,

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir //
translated: because there is no valid cognition that establishes cognition apart from that.

original: shes pa'i rgyu rnams nye ba las de nyid skyes par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu rnams nye ba las de nyid skyes par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that it arises from the proximity of the causes of consciousness.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa na re /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa na re /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and so on say:

original: gsal ba de bstan pa 'di ni shes bya dang / shes pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba de bstan pa 'di ni shes bya dang / shes pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The manifestation of that object is not a characteristic of the object of knowledge and consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi yul la shes pa nang nas skyes pas gsal bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul la shes pa nang nas skyes pas gsal bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: Because consciousness arises from within with regard to an external object, it becomes manifest.

original: shes pa la yang de shes pa skyes pas gsal bar gyur pa'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: shes pa la yang de shes pa skyes pas gsal bar gyur pa'o zhes zer na /
translated: And with regard to consciousness, it becomes manifest because consciousness arises.

original: de yang shin tu rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩdon rnams kyi gsal ba nyams su myong bas grub pa 'di gsal bar ni tshangs pas kyang mi nus pa'i phyir dang / de med par gyur na sngon po la sogs pa myong bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang shin tu rigs pa ma yin te / don rnams kyi gsal ba nyams su myong bas grub pa 'di gsal bar ni tshangs pas kyang mi nus pa'i phyir dang / de med par gyur na sngon po la sogs pa myong bar bya ba ni /
translated: That is also not very reasonable.üîΩBecause even BrahmƒÅ is not able to make this experience of the manifestation of objects, which is established, manifest.

original: brgya byin gyis kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis kyang mi nus te /
translated: And if it did not exist, even Indra would not be able to experience blue and so on.

original: shes pa skyes par gyur kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gsal ba ma yin pa lkog tu gyur pa de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa skyes par gyur kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gsal ba ma yin pa lkog tu gyur pa de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though consciousness has arisen, the nature of blue, etc., is not fully evident, but remains hidden.

original: de ltar shes pa la yang shes pa gzhan skyes su zin kyang gsal ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa la yang shes pa gzhan skyes su zin kyang gsal ba ma yin pas /
translated: In the same way, even though another consciousness has arisen in regard to that consciousness, it is not evident.

original: shes pa yang gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: shes pa yang gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: Thus, consciousness is not evident.

original: 'gro ba thams cad long ba dang / lkugs par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad long ba dang / lkugs par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it follows, absurdly, that all beings are blind and mute.

original: ma yin te shes pas don gsal bar myong ngo zhes smras so zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te shes pas don gsal bar myong ngo zhes smras so zhe na /
translated: You may say: Consciousness experiences the object as evident.

original: rnam par shes pa gsal ba las tha dad par 'gyur la //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal ba las tha dad par 'gyur la //
translated: But then consciousness would be different from the evident,

original: ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /üîΩyongs su @146a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur / yongs su @146a * //
translated: and how could it be evident?

original: bcad pas so zhe na /
analyzed: bcad pas so zhe na /
translated: You may say: It is evident because it is ascertained.

original: gsal ba ma yin par ji ltar gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsal ba ma yin par ji ltar gcod par 'gyur /
translated: But how can something that is not evident be ascertained?

original: ci ste gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say: It is evident,

original: gsal ba de nyid yongs su gsal ba dang / gsal bzhin ba dang / myong ba zhes bya na /
analyzed: gsal ba de nyid yongs su gsal ba dang / gsal bzhin ba dang / myong ba zhes bya na /
translated: then that very evidence is what is called fully evident, evident, and experience.

original: gsal ba de ji ltar shas bya'i chos ma yin /
analyzed: gsal ba de ji ltar shas bya'i chos ma yin /
translated: How could that evidence not be a phenomenon that is cognized?

original: shes bya'i chos su grub pa nyid kyis na lhag ma sngar bshad pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i chos su grub pa nyid kyis na lhag ma sngar bshad pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is established as an object of knowledge, the rest is as explained earlier.

original: gzhan dag na re shes pa ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes pa ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Others say: Cognition has the nature of clarity.

original: rang gi ngang gis gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis gsal ba yin la /
translated: It is clear by its intrinsic nature.

original: yul ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas shes pa dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: yul ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas shes pa dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: But the object does not have that nature, so it becomes clear by the power of its relation to cognition.

original: de dag ltar na yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ltar na yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: But if it is not clear by its intrinsic nature,

original: gsal bar byas pas gsal bar yang gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byas pas gsal bar yang gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then it becomes clear by being made clear, and this is mutually contradictory.

original: yang ji ltar 'brel pas des don rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'brel pas des don rig par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how does it become clear by its relation to cognition?

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i 'brel pas bsdus pas so zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i 'brel pas bsdus pas so zhe na /
translated: It is included by being related to the same collection.

original: mig kyang mig gi rnam par shes pas rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig kyang mig gi rnam par shes pas rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the eye would also be cognized by visual consciousness.

original: yul ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would not be an object.

original: gsal ba med na gzugs kyang ji ltar yul du gyur 'dis yul yin pa'i phyir rig go zhes bya ba yang gsal to //üîΩgzhan dag na re mar me'i 'od reg pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gsal ba med na gzugs kyang ji ltar yul du gyur 'dis yul yin pa'i phyir rig go zhes bya ba yang gsal to // gzhan dag na re mar me'i 'od reg pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: If there is no illumination, how can form be an object?

original: shes pa'i gsal ba dang phrad pas gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: shes pa'i gsal ba dang phrad pas gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that form is illuminated by contact with the illumination of consciousness, like a pot by the illumination of a lamp.

original: de'i ltar na yang me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gzugs mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba de ni de'i dri dang ro dang reg bya yang myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ltar na yang me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gzugs mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba de ni de'i dri dang ro dang reg bya yang myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if that were so, then when the eye consciousness experiences the form of a flower, for example, it would also experience the flower‚Äôs smell, taste, and tangible properties,

original: phrad pa las bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phrad pa las bye brag med pa'i phyir ro // gal te yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there would be no difference in the contact.üîΩIf you say that the smell, taste, and tangible properties are not experienced because they are not objects of the eye consciousness,

original: de yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang bshad zin to //
translated: we have already explained that this is not a valid reason.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa myong ba thams cad ni shes pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol gzung ba'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa myong ba thams cad ni shes pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol gzung ba'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore all experiences of blue and so on are consciousness itself and not external objects.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re 'di ni kho bo cag kyang mi 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re 'di ni kho bo cag kyang mi 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that we do not deny this.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: All consciousnesses have aspects.

original: 'di ltar don gang dag gis rnam par shes pa'i me long la gzugs brnyan gzhag par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar don gang dag gis rnam par shes pa'i me long la gzugs brnyan gzhag par gyur pas /
translated: In this way, the reflection of an object is placed in the mirror of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa des de'i gzugs brnyan myong yang nye bar brtags pa byas na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa des de'i gzugs brnyan myong yang nye bar brtags pa byas na /
translated: If one examines the experience of the reflection of that object by that consciousness,

original: me long gi ngos la rang gi byad kyi gzugs brnyan mthong ba bzhin du de myong bar bzhag go //
analyzed: me long gi ngos la rang gi byad kyi gzugs brnyan mthong ba bzhin du de myong bar bzhag go //
translated: it is like seeing the reflection of one‚Äôs face in a mirror.

original: de yang me long la @146b phyi rol gyi don mthong ba ni shin tu mthun pa ma yin pas cung zad 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang me long la @146b phyi rol gyi don mthong ba ni shin tu mthun pa ma yin pas cung zad 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, seeing external objects in a mirror is not very clear, so it is slightly mistaken.

original: blo'i me long la snang ba ni shin tu mthun pa'i phyir cung zad kyang shin tu 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: blo'i me long la snang ba ni shin tu mthun pa'i phyir cung zad kyang shin tu 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: But the appearance in the mirror of the mind is very clear, so it is not mistaken in the least.

original: de dag gi yang shes pa des 'brel pa gang gis don de myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gi yang shes pa des 'brel pa gang gis don de myong bar 'gyur /
translated: But how does that consciousness experience that object through a relationship?

original: de las byung ba'i 'brel pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'brel pas so zhe na /
translated: If you say it is through a relationship of origination,

original: mig kyang mig gi rnam par shes pas myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig kyang mig gi rnam par shes pas myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the eye would experience the eye consciousness.

original: 'on te 'dra ba'i dbang gis so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba'i dbang gis so zhe na /
translated: But if it is by virtue of similarity,

original: don gcig mthong ba'i skye bo mang po rnams kyi shes pa yang phan tshun mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gcig mthong ba'i skye bo mang po rnams kyi shes pa yang phan tshun mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the consciousnesses of many people who see the same object would see each other.

original: 'on te de las skye ba dang / der snang ba gnyi gas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de las skye ba dang / der snang ba gnyi gas so zhe na /
translated: But if it is by virtue of both arising from that and appearing as that,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang yul dang mtshungs par yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang yul dang mtshungs par yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the similar immediately preceding condition would also be the object, since it is similar to the object.

original: yang bdag nyid kun gyis mtshungs na ni /
analyzed: yang bdag nyid kun gyis mtshungs na ni /
translated: But if it is by virtue of being similar in all aspects,

original: shes pa yang bems po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa yang bems po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then consciousness would be matter.

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: But if it is by virtue of being similar in some aspects,

original: kun gyis thams cad rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun gyis thams cad rig par 'gyur /
translated: then everything would be known by everything.

original: mi slu ba'i shes pa yang don las gcig tu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i shes pa yang don las gcig tu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Nondeceptive consciousness also does not arise from a single object,

original: rmi lam bden pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam bden pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is confused by the truth of dreams.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore external objects do not exist.

original: ci ste don rnams bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste don rnams bden pa ma yin te /
translated: But if objects are not true,

original: rnam par shes pa don du snang ba yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don du snang ba yin na /
translated: and consciousness appears as an object,

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can objects, times, etc. be ascertained as they appear?

original: don med par yang thog ma med pa nas kun du brtags pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems nyid yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa'i don du snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don med par yang thog ma med pa nas kun du brtags pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems nyid yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa'i don du snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though they are non-existent, consciousnesses perceiving objects, times, etc. as having a definite meaning arise from the mind itself, which is disturbed by beginningless, all-conceiving latent potentialities.

original: gnyid kyis nyams pa'i rmi lam bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyid kyis nyams pa'i rmi lam bzhin no //
translated: This is like the dream of one who is exhausted by sleep.

original: de skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /üîΩji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa'i //
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa'i //
translated: Thus it says in the noble Descent into Lanka:üîΩJust as external objects

original: phyi rol don ni yod min yang //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod min yang //
translated: Do not exist as conceived by the childish,

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by latent potentialities

original: don du snang ba rab tu 'byung //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu 'byung // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Arises as the appearance of objects.

original: bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ni nye bar bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ni nye bar bcom pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDisturbed by latent potentialities‚Äù means ‚Äúdestroyed by latent potentialities.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na gcig la mang po rnams kyi shes pa 'khrul pa mtshungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig la mang po rnams kyi shes pa 'khrul pa mtshungs she na /
translated: How can the error of many consciousnesses be similar in one?

original: nye bar bcom pa mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye bar bcom pa mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the destruction is similar.

original: rab rib kyis mig nye bar bcom pa mtshungs pa rnams la skra shad dang / sha sbrang la sogs pa la snang ba mtshungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rab rib kyis mig nye bar bcom pa mtshungs pa rnams la skra shad dang / sha sbrang la sogs pa la snang ba mtshungs pa bzhin te /
translated: For those whose eyes are equally afflicted by cataracts, the appearance of falling hairs is the same.

original: la lar rmi lam mi bden bzhin du /
analyzed: la lar rmi lam mi bden bzhin du /
translated: For some, even though dreams are false,

original: bag chags mthug po'i dbang gis mi slu bar snang ngo //
analyzed: bag chags mthug po'i dbang gis mi slu bar snang ngo //
translated: due to the power of thick latent tendencies, they appear undeceivingly.

original: de'i phyir yang gzung ba yang ci yang med la 'dzin pa yang cung zad kyang @147a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gzung ba yang ci yang med la 'dzin pa yang cung zad kyang @147a * //
translated: Therefore, there is no apprehended object at all, and there is not the slightest apprehending subject.

original: med do // chos thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam mo //
analyzed: med do // chos thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam mo //
translated: All phenomena are consciousness only, empty of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzhan yang khams bcva brgyad po 'di tha dad pa'i gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams bcva brgyad po 'di tha dad pa'i gcig ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, these eighteen constituents are not a single different thing.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyang gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyang gcig ma yin no //
translated: The form constituent is not a single thing.

original: lus dang khyim dang / ljon shing la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang khyim dang / ljon shing la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because body, house, tree, and so on are different.

original: lus kyang gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyang gcig ma yin te /
translated: The body is not a single thing.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because hand, foot, and so on are different.

original: lag pa yang gcig ma yin te mdzub mo la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmdzub mo yang gcig ma yin te tshigs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag pa yang gcig ma yin te mdzub mo la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro // mdzub mo yang gcig ma yin te tshigs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hand is not one, because the fingers and so on are different.üîΩThe finger is not one, because the joints and so on are different.

original: mdzub mo yang gcig ma yin te tshigs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzub mo yang gcig ma yin te tshigs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The finger is not one, because the joints and so on are different.

original: tshigs kyang gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs kyang gcig ma yin te /
translated: The joint is not one, because the parts are different.

original: de'i tshe tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, they are different.

original: tshigs la sogs pa'i cha yang cha shas dang bcas pa gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: tshigs la sogs pa'i cha yang cha shas dang bcas pa gcig ma yin no //
translated: The part of the joint and so on also does not have one part.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab cha shas med pa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab cha shas med pa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the partless subtle particle becomes one,

original: ma yin te rtag tu rags par snang ba'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab gcig mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rtag tu rags par snang ba'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab gcig mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not so, because it always appears as coarse, and because the subtle particle is not seen as one.

original: rdul phra rab mang po phan tshun ldan pas de ltar mthong ba bzhin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab mang po phan tshun ldan pas de ltar mthong ba bzhin no zhes zer na /
translated: If it is said that many subtle particles are seen in that way by mutually combining,

original: gal te cha shas kyi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: gal te cha shas kyi sbyor ba ni /
translated: if the combination of parts

original: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab tu mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab tu mi 'gyur la /
translated: does not become a subtle particle without parts,üîΩand if the subtle particle is not seen as one,

original: ci ste cha shas med par sbyor na ni /
analyzed: ci ste cha shas med par sbyor na ni /
translated: If you apply it to the partless,

original: de'i tshe de dag tha mi dad pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag tha mi dad pas /
translated: then at that time, since they are not different,

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor yang rdul phra rab gcig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor yang rdul phra rab gcig tu 'gyur la /
translated: the earth mandala would be a single subtle particle.

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'brel pa'i gzugs gzhan snang ba rnams kyang /
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'brel pa'i gzugs gzhan snang ba rnams kyang /
translated: And the other forms that appear connected to the earth mandala

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor dang gnyis su med par thams cad rdul phra rab gcig gi tshad du 'gyur la de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor dang gnyis su med par thams cad rdul phra rab gcig gi tshad du 'gyur la de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: would all be the same size as the earth mandala, which is not the case.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab mang po'am /
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab mang po'am /
translated: Therefore, whether many subtle particles

original: cig shos kyang rung ste gcig tu gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: cig shos kyang rung ste gcig tu gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: or the other, nothing becomes one.

original: gzugs gcig med pas na //
analyzed: gzugs gcig med pas na //
translated: Since one form does not exist,

original: de 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir du ma yang med de /
analyzed: de 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir du ma yang med de /
translated: since it is an aggregation, many also do not exist.

original: de bas na gzugs kyi khams gang yang gcig gam /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyi khams gang yang gcig gam /
translated: Therefore, since no element of form is one,

original: du ma'am / gcig kyang ma yin du ma yang ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: du ma'am / gcig kyang ma yin du ma yang ma yin pa'am /
translated: many, neither one nor many,

original: dngos po bgrod pa gzhan yang med pas gzugs kyi khams ni dngos po med de brdzun pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dngos po bgrod pa gzhan yang med pas gzugs kyi khams ni dngos po med de brdzun pa kho na yin no //
translated: or any other category, the element of form does not exist as a thing; it is only false.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the form element,

original: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus kyi khams rnams kyang rdul phra rab 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus kyi khams rnams kyang rdul phra rab 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the sound, smell, taste, and tangible-object elements, and the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body constituents are also merely collections of atoms.

original: de ltar dmigs pa rnam pa lnga dang / rten rnam pa lnga med pas /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa rnam pa lnga dang / rten rnam pa lnga med pas /
translated: Thus, since the five kinds of objects and the five kinds of faculties do not exist,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga'i khams kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga'i khams kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the five kinds of consciousness that have them as their objects also do not exist.

original: de dag @147b med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag @147b med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since they do not exist, the mind consciousness also does not exist.

original: srid na yang de'i tshe rnam par shes pa zhes brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: srid na yang de'i tshe rnam par shes pa zhes brjod par bya'i /
translated: Even if it did exist, it would be called consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag gi don ni med do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag gi don ni med do //
translated: but it would not be called the mind consciousness, because it would have no special meaning.

original: yid kyi khams kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind element also does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa drug po gang yin pa 'gags pa de nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i rten du gyur pas yid kyi khams zhes bya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa drug po gang yin pa 'gags pa de nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i rten du gyur pas yid kyi khams zhes bya bar 'dod pas /
translated: Thus, the six consciousnesses are the basis for the arising of the subsequent mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mental element does not exist as a substance apart from the six consciousnesses.

original: btags par yod pa tsam mo //
analyzed: btags par yod pa tsam mo //
translated: It is a mere nominal designation.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po bkag pas de yang med par 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po bkag pas de yang med par 'gyur te //
translated: Since the six consciousnesses do not exist, the mental element also does not exist.

original: de bas na yid kyi khams kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi khams kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental element does not exist.

original: de med pas kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams med do //
analyzed: de med pas kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams med do //
translated: Since it does not exist, the mental consciousness also does not exist.üîΩThe entire element of mental objects would be included in the ten elements.

original: chos kyi khams ma lus par 'gyur ro zhe na de yang skye mched bcu las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ma lus par 'gyur ro zhe na de yang skye mched bcu las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: The mental objects that are not included in the ten elements are the mental objects that are derivative form, the dharmas that are not associated with the mind, and the unconditioned dharms.

original: de la re zhig gzugs ni gzugs kyi khams bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs ni gzugs kyi khams bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Among these, derivative form does not exist, just as form does not exist.

original: rdul phra rab 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely a composite of subtle particles.

original: ci ste rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs rdul phra rab 'dus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs rdul phra rab 'dus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that nonindicative form is not a composite of subtle particles,

original: 'o na gzugs can ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs can ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
translated: then why not accept that it is not physical?

original: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rdzas su 'dod pa bkag zin to //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rdzas su 'dod pa bkag zin to //
translated: The master has already refuted the assertion that nonindicative form is a substance.

original: sems las skyes pas na sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems las skyes pas na sems las byung ba ste /
translated: Mental factors are called mental factors because they arise from the mind.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam grangs yin la /
translated: Mind, thought and consciousness are synonyms.

original: des na rnam par shes pa drug bkag pas sems las byung ba yang bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa drug bkag pas sems las byung ba yang bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the six consciousnesses are refuted, mental factors are also refuted.

original: gzhan yang sems las byung ba dag ni sems dang rten dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa med par 'dod do //üîΩdes ni rten drug bkag pas kyang de dag dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems las byung ba dag ni sems dang rten dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa med par 'dod do // des ni rten drug bkag pas kyang de dag dgag par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, mental factors are asserted to be inseparable from the mind, the support and the focal object.üîΩSince the six supports are refuted, they are also refuted.

original: dmigs pa drug kyang bkag pa dang 'gegs par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa drug kyang bkag pa dang 'gegs par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Since the six focal objects are refuted and will be refuted, they are also refuted.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed gzhan dag las gud na med par ci rigs par shes par bya'o//
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed gzhan dag las gud na med par ci rigs par shes par bya'o//
translated: It should be understood that they are not separate from other mental formations.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams kyang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po rnams las tha dad par 'gyur ba'i lus kyi rdzas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams kyang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po rnams las tha dad par 'gyur ba'i lus kyi rdzas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, the unconditioned do not have a substantial body that is separate from the things that are unconditioned.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi khams kyang med la de med pas de'i dmigs pa bkag pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi khams kyang med la de med pas de'i dmigs pa bkag pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, the element of mental objects does not exist. Since that does not exist, the element of mental consciousness, which has that as its object, is also refuted.

original: de ltar khams bcva brgyad med la /üîΩkhams @148a * //
analyzed: de ltar khams bcva brgyad med la / khams @148a * //
translated: Thus, the eight elements do not exist.

original: rnams bkag pas /
analyzed: rnams bkag pas /
translated: Since the elements are refuted,

original: skye mched rnams dang / phung po rnams bkag pa yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched rnams dang / phung po rnams bkag pa yang grub pa yin no //
translated: the sense bases and the aggregates are also refuted.

original: da ni ji ltar phung po la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar phung po la sogs pa med na /
translated: Now, if the aggregates and so on do not exist,

original: der snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: der snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can they appear?

original: de dag med kyang bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems nyid der snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag med kyang bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i sems nyid der snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Even though they do not exist, consciousness arises as the appearance of those things, as explained earlier.

original: de skad du lang kar gshegs pa las //
analyzed: de skad du lang kar gshegs pa las //
translated: As it says in the S≈´tra on Entering Lanka:

original: ji ltar me long la ni gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar me long la ni gzugs //
translated: Just as in a mirror, an image

original: gcig dang gzhan pa rnams spangs pa //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan pa rnams spangs pa //
translated: is neither identical with nor different from the form,

original: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
translated: is seen but does not exist there,

original: de bzhin dngos rnams ngo bo nyid //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos rnams ngo bo nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: so it is with things and their nature.

original: sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag shes pa'i rnam pa yin par gyur kyang /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag shes pa'i rnam pa yin par gyur kyang /
translated: Although these blue things and so on are the aspects of consciousness,

original: dngos po med cing brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med cing brdzun pa yin te /
translated: they are unreal and false,

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin yang gcig dang du ma nyid dang bral ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i phyir dang / bag chags kyis bcom pa'i sgras kyang bag chags kyis nyams pa las skyes pa'i 'khrul pa'i mtshan mar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin yang gcig dang du ma nyid dang bral ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i phyir dang / bag chags kyis bcom pa'i sgras kyang bag chags kyis nyams pa las skyes pa'i 'khrul pa'i mtshan mar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, although they are of the nature of consciousness, they are devoid of being either identical with or different from consciousness, and because the term ‚Äúdegraded by latent impressions‚Äù indicates that they are false images produced from latent impressions that have degenerated.

original: 'o na brdzun pa de ji ltar der snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na brdzun pa de ji ltar der snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can that which is false appear as that?

original: gsal ba dang lhan cig tu brdzun pa'i bdag nyid du 'brel pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: gsal ba dang lhan cig tu brdzun pa'i bdag nyid du 'brel pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: It is through the power of the connection of the false self with the clear.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa las gsal bzhin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa las gsal bzhin pa yin la /
translated: Thus, consciousness itself is the clear self, and the clear self is consciousness itself.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa'i dbang gis 'khrul nas /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa'i dbang gis 'khrul nas /
translated: Due to the influence of beginningless latent potentialities, there is delusion.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa brdzun pa yang /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa brdzun pa yang /
translated: False forms such as blue

original: rmi lam bzhin du gsal bzhin bar snang ba yin pas sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar grub ste /
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin du gsal bzhin bar snang ba yin pas sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar grub ste /
translated: appear clearly, like dreams. Therefore, blue and so forth are established as clear.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma btags par de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma btags par de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable for them to be clear without being designated as such.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de gsal bzhin pa yin yang gnod pa yod pa'i phyir brdzun pa yang grub po //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de gsal bzhin pa yin yang gnod pa yod pa'i phyir brdzun pa yang grub po //
translated: Although blue and so forth are clear, they are established as false because they are impaired.

original: de brdzun par grub pas na de'i bdag nyid de yang brdzun par grub po //
analyzed: de brdzun par grub pas na de'i bdag nyid de yang brdzun par grub po //
translated: Since they are established as false, their nature is also established as false.

original: yang gsal ba de rig pa ni 'khrul pa dang bral bas mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gsal ba de rig pa ni 'khrul pa dang bral bas mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du grub pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the awareness of that clarity is direct perception because it is free from delusion. Therefore, it is established as an entity.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba ni gsal ba nyid kyis gnyug ma'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba ni gsal ba nyid kyis gnyug ma'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Because clarity is the intrinsic nature of clarity.

original: gang gi myong ba 'di 'khrul bar 'jog pa'i bslad pas gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi myong ba 'di 'khrul bar 'jog pa'i bslad pas gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this experience is not posited by the impairment that posits it as delusion.

original: yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bslad pas byas par 'gyur la //
analyzed: yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bslad pas byas par 'gyur la //
translated: Moreover, because of being the nature of blue, etc., it is produced by a mistake.

original: de ltar gyur pas na nge myong ba yang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pas na nge myong ba yang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of that, the experience of it is also a mistake.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa la ni gnod pa @148b 'jug pa'i skabs yod kyi gsal ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa la ni gnod pa @148b 'jug pa'i skabs yod kyi gsal ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is an occasion for the refutation of blue, etc., but not for the refutation of manifestation.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dang / dbu ma pa shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba kha cig na re /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dang / dbu ma pa shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba kha cig na re /
translated: Some Yogacaras and Madhyamikas who advocate that consciousness has aspects say:

original: sngon po dang gsal ba dag brdzun pa dang brdzun pa ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: sngon po dang gsal ba dag brdzun pa dang brdzun pa ma yin par gyur na /
translated: If blue and manifestation are false and not false,

original: chos 'gal ba nyid kyis na de'i bdag nyid du 'thad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba nyid kyis na de'i bdag nyid du 'thad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: because of the contradiction of attributes, it is not tenable that they are of the same nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin na yang sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur na sngon po la sogs pa ni gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin na yang sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur na sngon po la sogs pa ni gsal ba yin te /
translated: And if they are not of the same nature, manifestation will not be blue, etc., but blue, etc., is manifestation.

original: sgro btags pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i gsal ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa ni sgro ma btags pa'i dngos por gyur pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i gsal ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa ni sgro ma btags pa'i dngos por gyur pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Because it is not different from the manifest entity that is the superimposition, blue and so on are the entity that is the non-superimposition.

original: de dag gi ltar na gsal ba thams cad phyin ci ma log pa'i rang gi ngo bo myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na gsal ba thams cad phyin ci ma log pa'i rang gi ngo bo myong ba'i phyir /
translated: According to them, since all manifest entities are the experience of an unmistaken nature,

original: thams cad 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: all would be nonerroneous.

original: des na sems can thams cad rtag tu grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na sems can thams cad rtag tu grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore all sentient beings would always be liberated,

original: rtag tu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and they would always be perfect buddhas.

original: ci ste rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'khrul pas rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa yod pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'khrul pas rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa yod pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that is not so because the erroneous conceptual mind has the fault of conceiving its own unreal appearances to be real,

original: gsal bas mngon par zhen par bya ba yin bzhin du /
analyzed: gsal bas mngon par zhen par bya ba yin bzhin du /
translated: then just as the manifest entity is what is conceived,

original: ji ltar de la de gsal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de la de gsal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: how could it not be manifest to it?

original: ci ste gsal na ni gsal ba nyid dang / de'i don dag nyid de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ci ste gsal na ni gsal ba nyid dang / de'i don dag nyid de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: If it is clear, then it is clear itself and its object is itself, so

original: don med bzhin du zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: don med bzhin du zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur bas /
translated: it would not be ‚Äúas if non-existent.‚Äù

original: 'das pa'i mang pos bkur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag dang / sgra rtag pa dang / bdag yod pa dang / ba lang nyid do snyam pa la sogs pa thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid gsal bar myong ba'i nges pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i mang pos bkur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag dang / sgra rtag pa dang / bdag yod pa dang / ba lang nyid do snyam pa la sogs pa thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid gsal bar myong ba'i nges pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all such things as the past, the future, the permanence of sound, the existence of a self, and the thought ‚Äúit is a cow‚Äù would be ascertained as having the nature of the clear experience of their own characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang brda dang 'dre bar mi rigs pas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang brda dang 'dre bar mi rigs pas /
translated: And since it is not possible for a specific characteristic to be mixed with a signifier,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo yang med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na ba lang gsal ba thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo yang med par 'gyur ro // de bas na ba lang gsal ba thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa /
translated: the conceptual mind would not exist.

original: ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i blo mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i blo mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: Therefore, the nature of a cow is a mental expression that is common to all clear instances of a cow.

original: bslad pa'i dbang gis brdzun par snang ba yin la /
analyzed: bslad pa'i dbang gis brdzun par snang ba yin la /
translated: It is a false appearance due to the power of error.

original: de ltar snang ba la 'di ni ba lang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba la 'di ni ba lang yin no //
translated: And in that appearance, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a cow.‚Äù

original: mngon par zhen par 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par 'dod par bya ste /
translated: One should not cling to it as real.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin yang /
translated: Even though the specific characteristic does not appear,

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis mngon par zhen pa de lta bu la ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis mngon par zhen pa de lta bu la ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no fault in that kind of clinging due to delusion.

original: gang gi phyir bslad pa'i dbang gis blo 'khrul te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bslad pa'i dbang gis blo 'khrul te /
translated: Because the mind is deluded by the power of error,

original: de la gang gi tshe ba lang ma yin pa las log pa'i mtshan nyid ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni blo @149a * //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe ba lang ma yin pa las log pa'i mtshan nyid ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni blo @149a * //
translated: when the characteristic of a cow is said to be the opposite of what is not a cow,

original: dang rang gi mtshan nyid gnyi ga la de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dang rang gi mtshan nyid gnyi ga la de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: both the mind and the specific characteristic become its nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pas snang ba dang mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pas snang ba dang mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: By becoming its nature, it appears and is clung to.

original: 'di dag thams cad blos bslad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad blos bslad pa yin gyi /
translated: All of this is the mind's error,

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: not the reality of things, so there is no fault.

original: blos bslad pa yang ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: blos bslad pa yang ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind's error is posited according to what is commonly known,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: not according to what is truly real.

original: nyams su myong bas grags pa de bzhin du tha snyad kyi yan lag tu grub pa ni bzlog par dka' la de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong bas grags pa de bzhin du tha snyad kyi yan lag tu grub pa ni bzlog par dka' la de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the fame of the experience is established as a part of the conventional, it is difficult to reverse, and it is not reasonable to be just as it is in reality.

original: ba lang la log par zhen pa tsam gyis de tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi slu bar 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang la log par zhen pa tsam gyis de tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi slu bar 'thad pa yin no //
translated: It is tenable that it is non-deceptive merely by the adherence to the cow, because of the connection with that.

original: ji ltar pa lang nyid brdzun pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar pa lang nyid brdzun pa la /
translated: Just as cow-ness is false,

original: ba lang gi blo gsal zhing de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / de las tha dad pa ma yin bzhin du yang dngos po med pa dang / sgro btags pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ba lang gi blo gsal zhing de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / de las tha dad pa ma yin bzhin du yang dngos po med pa dang / sgro btags pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: the cognition of the cow is clear and becomes its nature, and while not being different from that, it is not a non-entity and is not an imputation.

original: gsal ba yang sngon po la sogs pa gsal bzhin pa dang / bdag nyid du grub kyang brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba yang sngon po la sogs pa gsal bzhin pa dang / bdag nyid du grub kyang brdzun pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the clear appearance is also false while being the clear appearance of blue, etc. and being established as its nature.

original: brdzun pa dang brdzun pa ma yin pa dag rang bzhin sna tshogs kyi mthar thug pas rdzas gcig la 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa dang brdzun pa ma yin pa dag rang bzhin sna tshogs kyi mthar thug pas rdzas gcig la 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: False and non-false are not contradictory in one substance, because of the variety of natures that are final.

original: ci ste de'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs tsam gyi dngos po nyid dang / sgro ma btags pa nyid du bsgrubs na ni /
analyzed: ci ste de'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs tsam gyi dngos po nyid dang / sgro ma btags pa nyid du bsgrubs na ni /
translated: If you prove that the reason is just the nature of that, and that it is not a superimposition,

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pas ma des par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pas ma des par 'gyur la /
translated: then it is not established by the nature of cowhood, etc.

original: yang sgro ma btags pa de'i bdag nyid du gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod na ni ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sgro ma btags pa de'i bdag nyid du gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod na ni ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that the reason is the nature of that which is not a superimposition, then it is not established.

original: de bas na chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pas stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pas stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the position is that all these phenomena are mere representations, empty of object and subject.

original: de la khams gsum gyi chos gnyis gang yin pa med kyang gnyis su snang ba 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: de la khams gsum gyi chos gnyis gang yin pa med kyang gnyis su snang ba 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yin la /
translated: In that regard, although the two phenomena of the three realms do not exist, this appearance as two is an unreal imagination.

original: ji lta ba de la yid kyi brjod pas gzung ba dang gnyis su btags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba de la yid kyi brjod pas gzung ba dang gnyis su btags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In that way, the nature of the mind that is imputed as two by mental expression is the imagined nature.

original: ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the essence.

original: gnyis po de nyid kyis de stong pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis po de nyid kyis de stong pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that very duality by those two is the perfected nature.

original: de yang dngos po stong pas dngos po ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang dngos po stong pas dngos po ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, since things are empty, they are not things.

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since they have the characteristic of nonduality, they are not nonthings.

original: gang gi phyir 'di gnyis po med cing gnyis kyis stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam yin pa nyid kyis na ma yin par dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di gnyis po med cing gnyis kyis stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam yin pa nyid kyis na ma yin par dgag pa yin no //
translated: Since they are only representations that are devoid of duality and empty of duality, they are absolute negations.

original: ci ste med pa dgag pa yin na ni gcig kho nar med @149b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste med pa dgag pa yin na ni gcig kho nar med @149b pa ma yin te /
translated: If they were implicative negations, they would not be nonexistents.

original: de ltar na kun brtags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na kun brtags par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, they would be imagined,

original: gzhan du ma yin par dgag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin par dgag par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they would be absolute negations in another way.

original: de bas na don dam pa ni ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du ma yin par dgag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na don dam pa ni ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du ma yin par dgag pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate is an absolute negation in the way it is taught.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since it is the reality of unreal imagination,

original: de las tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: it is not different from it.

original: mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it different by way of a difference in characteristics.

original: chos rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The uncommon characteristic of things

original: de nyid de ma yin te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de ma yin te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that, because it is not common to all.

original: 'di ni 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba gcig go //
translated: This is the first division of their characteristics.

original: yang rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan mas nye bar bzung ba yin la /
analyzed: yang rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan mas nye bar bzung ba yin la /
translated: Again, the specific characteristics are apprehended by means of characteristics.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan ma thams cad nub pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan ma thams cad nub pa yin te /
translated: Emptiness is the disappearance of all characteristics.

original: 'di ni 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second division of their characteristics.

original: gnyis po stong pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba nyid ni chos thams cad la thams cad du khyad par med pas khyab pa dang rtag tu ba dang / 'gyur ba med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis po stong pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba nyid ni chos thams cad la thams cad du khyad par med pas khyab pa dang rtag tu ba dang / 'gyur ba med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The characteristic of the mere emptiness of the two is said to be all-pervading, permanent, and unchanging, because it is not differentiated at all in any phenomenon.

original: ming dang mtshan ma'i dri ma brdzun pa dang / mtshan mas nye bar bslad pa'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas de la glo bur gyi dri ma yin la /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma'i dri ma brdzun pa dang / mtshan mas nye bar bslad pa'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas de la glo bur gyi dri ma yin la /
translated: The stains of the false characteristics and signs and the stains of the obscurations that are adulterated by characteristics are adventitious to it, because they are not its nature.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gnyug ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gnyug ma yin no //
translated: The reality of phenomena is their intrinsic nature.

original: dri ma rnams ni kun tu brtags pa la mngon par zhen pa la rab tu 'byung bas /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni kun tu brtags pa la mngon par zhen pa la rab tu 'byung bas /
translated: The defilements are adventitious because they are produced by the adherence to the imaginary.

original: de dag bsal nas bsal bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir yang de la glo bur yin no //
analyzed: de dag bsal nas bsal bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir yang de la glo bur yin no //
translated: They can be removed because they can be removed.

original: gang zhig gus par yun ring du bsgoms pas /
analyzed: gang zhig gus par yun ring du bsgoms pas /
translated: The one who cultivates for a long time with devotion

original: bsgom pa rab kyis mthar phyin pa na /
analyzed: bsgom pa rab kyis mthar phyin pa na /
translated: attains the culmination of cultivation.

original: gsal bar snang ba srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba srid par 'gyur te /
translated: It is possible that the appearance will be clear,

original: 'dod pa dang / mya ngan dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi blo la bud med la sogs par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / mya ngan dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi blo la bud med la sogs par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: like the appearance of a woman, etc. in the mindstream of one who is desirous, sorrowful, fearful, etc.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang tshad mas grub pa 'di dag tsam mo zhes bya ba dang / sems tsam dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang tshad mas grub pa 'di dag tsam mo zhes bya ba dang / sems tsam dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i stong pa nyid de /
translated: All these dharmas are just these which are established by valid knowledge, and the mind-only, the emptiness with a remaining substratum, and the emptiness without a remaining substratum.

original: rnal 'byor gyis bzhi la goms par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis bzhi la goms par byas pa yin no //
translated: One should cultivate the four yogas.

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams dang de bzhin du dbu ma pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams dang de bzhin du dbu ma pa rnams ni /
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅra and the MƒÅdhyamika

original: rnal 'byor gyis bzhi pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis bzhi pa /
translated: cultivate the four yogas.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis dmigs su med cing shin tu snang ba med pa gcig tu dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa /üîΩnam mkha' lta bu'i snang ba 'jig rten @150a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis dmigs su med cing shin tu snang ba med pa gcig tu dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa / nam mkha' lta bu'i snang ba 'jig rten @150a * //
translated: All phenomena are not perceived due to emptiness, and are a single stainless infinite non-appearance.

original: las 'das pa'i ye shes yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i ye shes yin par 'dod do //
translated: The appearance that is like space is asserted to be supramundane wisdom.

original: de skad du klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang //
analyzed: de skad du klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang //
translated: Thus, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
translated: The elements and so on

original: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
analyzed: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
translated: are completely included in consciousness.

original: ye shes kyis ni de bral na //üîΩlog par rnam brtags cis ma yin //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni de bral na // log par rnam brtags cis ma yin //
translated: If they are separated by wisdom,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: why are they not just wrongly imagined?

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gnyug ma gsal ba tsam ni rdzas su yod par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gnyug ma gsal ba tsam ni rdzas su yod par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the YogƒÅcƒÅra assert that the intrinsic nature of phenomena is mere clarity and substantially existent.

original: dbu ma pa ni rdzas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: dbu ma pa ni rdzas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: The Madhyamaka do not assert that substance.

original: khyad par 'di yang ming tsam du rtogs so //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yang ming tsam du rtogs so //
translated: This difference is understood to be merely nominal.

original: des na rtsa ba med par rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams dang / dbu ma pa rnams lhan cig tu rtsod pa ni skye bo shin tu gnas ngan pa nyid /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba med par rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams dang / dbu ma pa rnams lhan cig tu rtsod pa ni skye bo shin tu gnas ngan pa nyid /
translated: Therefore, the YogƒÅcƒÅra and the MƒÅdhyamika argue together, and the people are in a very bad state.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: gang dag gang dang lhan cig de nyid ma mthong 'dir spyod pa ni kun mtshungs shing //
analyzed: gang dag gang dang lhan cig de nyid ma mthong 'dir spyod pa ni kun mtshungs shing //
translated: Those who do not see reality, who are equal here in their practice,

original: de nyid mthong tshe mun pa'i dri ma rab zad ye shes kyang ni gcig tu gyur pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid mthong tshe mun pa'i dri ma rab zad ye shes kyang ni gcig tu gyur pa yi //
translated: when they see reality, their darkness is completely destroyed, and their wisdom becomes one.

original: rtsa lag mchog gi rnal 'byor spyod pa pa la sdang bar sems ni 'dir bcas te //
analyzed: rtsa lag mchog gi rnal 'byor spyod pa pa la sdang bar sems ni 'dir bcas te //
translated: Those who are hostile to the supreme yogƒÅcƒÅra

original: rtsod par sems pa'i dbu ma mchog 'dzin 'di dag ci'i phyir rtsod cing shin tu smad //
analyzed: rtsod par sems pa'i dbu ma mchog 'dzin 'di dag ci'i phyir rtsod cing shin tu smad //
translated: why do they argue and greatly disparage the Madhyamaka, which is the supreme view?

original: de la phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dang / shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smar ba dbu ma pa dag ni /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dang / shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smar ba dbu ma pa dag ni /
translated: The proponents of external objects and the proponents of consciousness with aspects, the MƒÅdhyamikas,

original: lung bstan bcos dang tshad ma dag las phyi rol du gyur par sngar bzlog zin to //
analyzed: lung bstan bcos dang tshad ma dag las phyi rol du gyur par sngar bzlog zin to //
translated: have been refuted earlier in the scriptures, treatises, and valid cognitions as being external.

original: rnam pa med par smra ba'i sems tsam pa 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa med par smra ba'i sems tsam pa 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur te /
translated: Only the Mind Only school, which advocates the nonexistence of images, remains.

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir gsal ba brdzun pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir gsal ba brdzun pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Why do they accept that the clear image is false?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa brdzun pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa brdzun pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not different from the false image of blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It is like the blue, etc.

original: sgro ma btags pa'i tha dad pa med pa ni ma grub la /
analyzed: sgro ma btags pa'i tha dad pa med pa ni ma grub la /
translated: The nondifference that is not imputed is not established.

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa tsam nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa tsam nyid yin na ni /
translated: But if it is just nondifference,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is the uncertainty of doubt about the negation of the discordant side.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang yang dag par 'gyur ba dag la sgro 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid srid de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang yang dag par 'gyur ba dag la sgro 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid srid de /
translated: It is possible that there is the superimposition of the unreal and the real.

original: ba lang nyid dang / bdag nyid la sogs pa dang de dag gi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang / bdag nyid la sogs pa dang de dag gi blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of cowness and self, etc.

original: yang na stong pa nyid kyi 'khrul pas kyang ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid kyi 'khrul pas kyang ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, there is the uncertainty of doubt about emptiness, because of error.

original: de nyid kyang brdzun no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang brdzun no zhe na /
translated: But that itself is false.

original: sngon po la sogs pa mthong bzhin du /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mthong bzhin du /
translated: While seeing blue and so on,üîΩ

original: stong pa nyid mthong ba'i ye shes kyang 'khrul bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mthong ba'i ye shes kyang 'khrul bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the wisdom that sees emptiness is mistaken,üîΩsince it sees blue and so on.

original: brdzun pa ni 'khrul pas sgro btags @150b pa yin na /
analyzed: brdzun pa ni 'khrul pas sgro btags @150b pa yin na /
translated: If the false is a superimposition due to error,

original: gsal ba ni gsal bzhin pa nyid kyi gnyug pa'i rang bzhin du cha shas med par mngon sum gyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba ni gsal bzhin pa nyid kyi gnyug pa'i rang bzhin du cha shas med par mngon sum gyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then the manifest is established by direct perception as a partless intrinsic nature, since it is just manifest.

original: dngos po rnams la rang bzhin gnyug ma 'di ni gnyi ga la yang tshad mas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la rang bzhin gnyug ma 'di ni gnyi ga la yang tshad mas grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this intrinsic nature of things is established by valid cognition for both parties.

original: rang bzhin gnyug ma 'di grub pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyug ma 'di grub pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Since this intrinsic nature is established,

original: sgro ma btags pa dang / brdzun pa ma yin pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: sgro ma btags pa dang / brdzun pa ma yin pa grub pa'o //
translated: it is established that it is not a superimposition and is not false.

original: brdzun pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / 'khrul pa dang / sgro btags pa rnams ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / 'khrul pa dang / sgro btags pa rnams ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: False, not real, mistaken, and superimposed are synonyms.

original: ci ste yod par gyur pa'i chos gzhan dang bral bas med pa zhes bya ba la de nyid brdzun pa'i sgrar brjod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste yod par gyur pa'i chos gzhan dang bral bas med pa zhes bya ba la de nyid brdzun pa'i sgrar brjod kyi /
translated: If you say that something is called ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù because it is devoid of an existent other, then that itself is called the word ‚Äúfalse.‚Äù

original: sgro btags pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not superimposed.

original: de lta na yang snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / ma nges par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / ma nges par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, the reason is still unestablished and indefinite, as before.

original: gzhan yang gal te gnod pa can gyis med pa sgrub kyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gnod pa can gyis med pa sgrub kyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the nonexistence of something is established by a refuting agent, and not by superimposition,

original: de'i tshe gnod pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang / de'i blo rnams gnyug ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnod pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang / de'i blo rnams gnyug ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur la /
translated: then the nature of the nonexistence of that and the cognition of it would be intrinsic nature.

original: des na 'khrul pa gtan med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa gtan med par 'gyur te /
translated: And in that case, there would be no error at all.

original: de'i skyon kyang bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i skyon kyang bshad zin to //
translated: And the error of that has already been explained.üîΩAnd it contradicts this statement:

original: ye shes kyis ni de bral na //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni de bral na //
translated: If it is free from that by means of knowledge,

original: log par rnam brtags cis ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par rnam brtags cis ma yin // zhes bya ba 'di dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
