analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa la so sor rtog pa ni rab tu rnam par byed pa'o //
translated: The discrimination of the mode of being is thorough discrimination.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa shes rab dang lhan cig tu gyur pas mtshan ma'i rnam pa bzung ba ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa shes rab dang lhan cig tu gyur pas mtshan ma'i rnam pa bzung ba ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of the aspects of signs by the nondiscriminative mental attention that accompanies wisdom is full judgment.

original: kun tu dpyod pa ni yongs su dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu dpyod pa ni yongs su dpyod pa'o //
translated: Full investigation is full investigation.

original: 'di dag gi bshad pa ni 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bshad pa ni 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: The explanation of these is found in the Compendium of Higher Knowledge of the Mahayana, taught by the noble Maitreya.

original: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight?

original: ji ltar yang de chos rnam par 'byed /
analyzed: ji ltar yang de chos rnam par 'byed /
translated: It is the thorough differentiation of phenomena,

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed /üîΩyongs su rtog par byed /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed / yongs su rtog par byed /
translated: the thorough differentiation of them,

original: yongs su dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su dpyod par byed de /
translated: the thorough investigation of them,üîΩand the thorough analysis of them.

original: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma'i gnyen por blang pa dang / phyin ci log nges par bsal ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa la sems rnam par gzhag pa dag nye bar blangs nas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma'i gnyen por blang pa dang / phyin ci log nges par bsal ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa la sems rnam par gzhag pa dag nye bar blangs nas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is the thorough application of the antidotes to the signs of negative propensities, the thorough removal of error, and the thorough establishment of the mind in the absence of error.

original: 'dir tshig 'di dag gi don ni gnas ngan len ni phyin ci log gi bag chags te /
analyzed: 'dir tshig 'di dag gi don ni gnas ngan len ni phyin ci log gi bag chags te /
translated: Here, the meaning of these words is as follows. Negative propensities are the habitual tendencies of error.

original: de yang phyin ci log gong du skyed par byed pa'i nus pa sems kyi rgyud la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log gong du skyed par byed pa'i nus pa sems kyi rgyud la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: They are defined as the power to produce error, which resides in the mind stream.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni gang gi tshe yongs su gso bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni gang gi tshe yongs su gso bar byed pa ste /
translated: Their signs are that which is to be cured.

original: phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa snga ma snga ma dag go //
analyzed: phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa snga ma snga ma dag go //
translated: The former are the manifest attachments to the inversions.

original: de zad pas gnas ngan len zad de /
analyzed: de zad pas gnas ngan len zad de /
translated: By their exhaustion, the negative reflex actions are exhausted.

original: phyin ci log skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyin ci log skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The inversions do not arise.

original: mtshan ma'i gnyen po goms pa las mtshan ma zad pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gnyen po goms pa las mtshan ma zad pa yin te /
translated: The exhaustion of the signs is from the cultivation of the antidote to the signs.

original: gnyen po de ni rnam par 'byed /
analyzed: gnyen po de ni rnam par 'byed /
translated: That antidote is the discrimination

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: and the thorough discrimination.

original: de bas 'di gnyis ni gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma'i gnyen po nye bar blangs te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas 'di gnyis ni gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma'i gnyen po nye bar blangs te bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, these two are taught as the taking up of the antidote to the signs of negative reflex actions.

original: yongs su rtog pa ni phyin ci log nges par bsal ba nye bar blangs nas bstan te /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ni phyin ci log nges par bsal ba nye bar blangs nas bstan te /
translated: The thorough investigation is taught as the taking up of the certain elimination of the inversions.

original: gang gi phyir de ni ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par phye ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par phye bas phyin ci log gi dogs pa gcig tu bsal na brjod pa med pa yid la byed pas yongs su btsal nas lhag par @156a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par phye ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par phye bas phyin ci log gi dogs pa gcig tu bsal na brjod pa med pa yid la byed pas yongs su btsal nas lhag par @156a * //
translated: Because of that, when the inversions are completely eliminated by the discrimination of things as they are and the thorough discrimination of things as they are, then, by the attention to the inexpressible, one should thoroughly investigate and transcend the signs of the antidote.

original: dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ste /
translated: That is the thorough investigation.

original: de bas 'di ni phyin ci log nges par bsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas 'di ni phyin ci log nges par bsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the certain elimination of the inversions.

original: de ltar 'dis phyin ci log nges par bsal bas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dis phyin ci log nges par bsal bas /
translated: Thus, since this removes the ascertainment of error,

original: phyin ci ma log par byas la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par byas la /
translated: it makes it nonerroneous.

original: phyin ci ma log pa der mngon sum bzhin du mthong ba'i don la sems gzhag nas so sor rtog pa ni yongs su dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa der mngon sum bzhin du mthong ba'i don la sems gzhag nas so sor rtog pa ni yongs su dpyod pa ste /
translated: Having placed the mind in the object seen as if in direct perception, that nonerroneous object, one should discern it.

original: de bas na 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa la sems gzhag pa nye bar blangs te bstan pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa la sems gzhag pa nye bar blangs te bstan pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the teaching that takes up the placement of the mind in nonerroneous objects.

original: de ltar lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi pa'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las grol ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi pa'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las grol ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the completion of the cultivation of the four aspects of insight is the liberation from the bondage of negative propensities.

original: zhi gnas rnam pa dgu'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pas ni mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi gnas rnam pa dgu'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pas ni mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: The completion of the cultivation of the nine aspects of serenity is the liberation from the bondage of signs.

original: phyin ci log gi mtshan ma phyin ci log gi don rnam par 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mtshan ma phyin ci log gi don rnam par 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sign of error is the characteristic of the cessation of the erroneous object.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong dag / bsgoms pas gnas ngan len dang ni //üîΩmtshan ma yi ni 'ching ba las //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong dag / bsgoms pas gnas ngan len dang ni // mtshan ma yi ni 'ching ba las //
translated: Through cultivating serenity and insight,

original: rnal 'byor pa ni grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni grol bar 'gyur //
translated: the yogi is liberated fromüîΩthe bondage of the negative reflex actions

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: and the bondage of signs.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni ci rigs par sbyar la go rims bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni ci rigs par sbyar la go rims bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of this verse should be applied appropriately, not necessarily in order.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor dang bsgom pa ni rnam grangs yin la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor gyi thun mong gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor dang bsgom pa ni rnam grangs yin la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor gyi thun mong gi dbye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, yoga and cultivation are synonyms. The union of serenity and insight is a general classification of yoga.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor don du gnyer ba rnams la /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor don du gnyer ba rnams la /
translated: Here, for those who seek the yoga of the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnal 'byor gyi rnam bzhi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rnam bzhi brjod par bya ste /
translated: the four yogas should be explained.

original: dngos po ji snyed yod pa la dmigs pa dang / sems tsam la dmigs pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang / dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ji snyed yod pa la dmigs pa dang / sems tsam la dmigs pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang / dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: They are: the observation of the multiplicity of things, the observation of mind only, the observation of suchness, and the nonobservation of observation.

original: de la re zhig dang po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po brjod par bya ste /
translated: The first of these will be discussed first.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pas gcig pu dben par gnas te /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pas gcig pu dben par gnas te /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas, who are endowed with the perfect wisdom that comes from listening and reflection, live in solitude.

original: skyil mo krung bcas te /
analyzed: skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: They sit cross-legged

original: shin tu sgu ba yang ma yin shin tu dgye ba yang ma yin par lus drang por bsrang nas sems shin tu zhum pa yang ma yin shin tu 'phro ba yang ma yin par dran pa dang shes bzhin mngon du gzhag la /
analyzed: shin tu sgu ba yang ma yin shin tu dgye ba yang ma yin par lus drang por bsrang nas sems shin tu zhum pa yang ma yin shin tu 'phro ba yang ma yin par dran pa dang shes bzhin mngon du gzhag la /
translated: and straighten their bodies so that they are neither stooped nor stiff. They settle their minds in a state of mindfulness and vigilance that is neither too withdrawn nor too scattered.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba'i mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang rnam par shes pa yongs su bsdus la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba'i mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang rnam par shes pa yongs su bsdus la /
translated: They withdraw their eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and consciousness from their natural objects of distraction.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis mnyam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis mnyam par gzhag ste /
translated: They rest evenly in a state of perception that is accompanied by illumination.

original: sna tshogs 'di dag yid la bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag yid la bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They direct their attention to the following points:

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i @156b gzugs dang rgod pa dang bsdu ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang / ga pur dang / rnag la sogs pa'i dri dang / mngar ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa'i ro dang / grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa'i reg bya dang /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i @156b gzugs dang rgod pa dang bsdu ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang / ga pur dang / rnag la sogs pa'i dri dang / mngar ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa'i ro dang / grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa'i reg bya dang /
translated: Forms such as blue and yellow, sounds such as laughter and speech, smells such as camphor and pus, tastes such as sweet and sour, tactile objects such as cold and warm,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nam mkha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa ni chos te /üîΩde ltar gzung bar snang ba'i yul gyi khams drug go //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nam mkha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa ni chos te / de ltar gzung bar snang ba'i yul gyi khams drug go //
translated: happiness and suffering, desire and anger, space and nirvƒÅ·πáa, and so on are phenomena.üîΩThus, there are six elements of objects that appear as the apprehended.

original: yang de dag la 'dzin par snang ba'i ngang na gsal ba'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang de dag la 'dzin par snang ba'i ngang na gsal ba'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the six elements of consciousness that appear as the apprehender are as follows:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses are the eye consciousness, the ear consciousness, the nose consciousness, the tongue consciousness, the body consciousness, and the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po de dag gi rten ni dbang po'i khams drug ste de lnga ni gzugs can no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po de dag gi rten ni dbang po'i khams drug ste de lnga ni gzugs can no //
translated: The six sense faculties are the basis of the six consciousnesses. Five of them are material,

original: gcig ni gzugs med pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ni gzugs med pa ste /
translated: and one is not.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The five material sense faculties are:

original: mig 'bras kyi nang na zar ma'i me tog lta bu dang / rna ba'i gting na gro ga'i mdud pa lta bu dang / sna'i rtsa ba na thur ma lta bu dag dang / lce'i dkyil 'khor la skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam gyis bar mchod pa'i zla ba phyed pa lta bu gnyis dang /üîΩlus lta bu'i lus kyi dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i yid kyi /
analyzed: mig 'bras kyi nang na zar ma'i me tog lta bu dang / rna ba'i gting na gro ga'i mdud pa lta bu dang / sna'i rtsa ba na thur ma lta bu dag dang / lce'i dkyil 'khor la skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam gyis bar mchod pa'i zla ba phyed pa lta bu gnyis dang / lus lta bu'i lus kyi dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i yid kyi /
translated: the eye faculty, which is like a flower of the jasmine plant; the ear faculty, which is like a rolled up piece of birch bark; the nose faculty, which is like a bent copper tube; the tongue faculty, which is like a full moon on the surface of a pond;üîΩand the body faculty, which is like the body itself.

original: dbang po'i khams te /
analyzed: dbang po'i khams te /
translated: The mental faculty is the immediately preceding cessation of consciousness.

original: de ltar bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi yul rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams drug drug yongs su bsdus pa ni khams bco brgyad de /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi yul rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams drug drug yongs su bsdus pa ni khams bco brgyad de /
translated: Thus, the objects, consciousnesses, and faculties of oneself and all sentient beings are included in the eighteen constituents.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gnas pa sna tshogs yid la byas la /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gnas pa sna tshogs yid la byas la /
translated: Having brought to mind the various things that exist in the world systems of the ten directions,

original: sna tshogs snang ba'i sems de nyid dmigs pa nas yid kyi brjod pa spangs la zhi gnas bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba'i sems de nyid dmigs pa nas yid kyi brjod pa spangs la zhi gnas bsgom par bya ste /
translated: you should abandon mental expressions and cultivate serenity by focusing on the mind that perceives the variety of things.

original: ji tsam na lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob pa zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam na lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob pa zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: When you achieve physical and mental pliancy, you have completed the cultivation of serenity.

original: de nas zhi gnas de nyid la brten te de nyid du sna tshogs kyi gzugs brnyan 'di dag nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas zhi gnas de nyid la brten te de nyid du sna tshogs kyi gzugs brnyan 'di dag nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, on the basis of that serenity, you should analyze and investigate the various images of things that appear to you, such as the form constituent up to and including the mind constituent.

original: gzugs kyi khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar 'di dag ni chos thams cad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar 'di dag ni chos thams cad ces bya ste /
translated: These are called all phenomena.

original: de ltar lan mang du rnam par phye nas yongs su brtag par bya //
analyzed: de ltar lan mang du rnam par phye nas yongs su brtag par bya //
translated: You should analyze and investigate them in this way many times.

original: yongs su dpyad par bya bas lhag mthong rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dpyad par bya bas lhag mthong rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should complete insight by means of thorough analysis.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems de nyid @157a * //
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems de nyid @157a * //
translated: Then, after that, the mind that focuses on a conceptual image

original: la gnyi ga mnyam par dmigs pa'i sems kyis rgyun mi 'chad pa yid la byed pa'i rgyun 'jug pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la gnyi ga mnyam par dmigs pa'i sems kyis rgyun mi 'chad pa yid la byed pa'i rgyun 'jug pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: is the path that unites serenity and insight.üîΩThe Instructions on the Perfection of Wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag las /
translated: says:

original: ji snyed yod par gyur pa la dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: ji snyed yod par gyur pa la dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sa ste dang po'o /
translated: The first stage of yoga is to focus on the diversity of things.

original: // / de nas gnyis pa ni sna tshogs snang ba'i sems de bzhin du bskyed la /
analyzed: // / de nas gnyis pa ni sna tshogs snang ba'i sems de bzhin du bskyed la /
translated: Then, the second stage is to generate the mind that perceives the diversity of things.

original: 'di ltar nye bar brtag par bya ste /üîΩgzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar brtag par bya ste / gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One should investigate as follows:üîΩ‚ÄúThis so-called form is merely a name,‚Äù and so on up to:

original: ji srid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad kyang ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ji srid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad kyang ming tsam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are merely names.‚Äù

original: ming dang don dag ni shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir ming ni don du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang don dag ni shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir ming ni don du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the name and the object are completely different, the name does not exist as the object.

original: don mngon par mi shes par ming tsam du snang la /
analyzed: don mngon par mi shes par ming tsam du snang la /
translated: Without understanding the object, the name appears as mere name.

original: ming mngon par mi shes par yang don tsam du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming mngon par mi shes par yang don tsam du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Without understanding the name, the object appears as mere object.

original: de bas na ming ji lta ba bzhin du don med pas gzugs ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: de bas na ming ji lta ba bzhin du don med pas gzugs ni ming tsam ste /
translated: Therefore, since the object does not exist as the name, form is mere name.

original: don du ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: don du ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is not the object, and so on up to:

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du yang ming tsam yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du yang ming tsam yin no //
translated: all phenomena are mere names.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni tha snyad kyi don du glo bur du ming bsdebs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni tha snyad kyi don du glo bur du ming bsdebs te /
translated: Worldly people, for the sake of convention, suddenly combine names and

original: btags pa la gzugs zhes bya ba'i don du rtog pa nas /
analyzed: btags pa la gzugs zhes bya ba'i don du rtog pa nas /
translated: conceive of the object as form,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du rtog ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du rtog ste /
translated: and so on up to: they conceive of all phenomena.

original: de bas na gzugs nas chos thams cad kyi bar du ming gi don du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs nas chos thams cad kyi bar du ming gi don du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, form and so on do not exist as the object of the name, and so on up to: all phenomena do not exist as the object of the name.

original: yang 'di dag ni sems tsam te /
analyzed: yang 'di dag ni sems tsam te /
translated: Moreover, these are mere mind.

original: don 'di dag med bzhin du don snang ba la don du mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis skye bar snang ste /üîΩrgyan po la goms pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: don 'di dag med bzhin du don snang ba la don du mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis skye bar snang ste / rgyan po la goms pa'i dbang gis /
translated: They appear as objects of play because of the power of habitual tendencies.üîΩThey appear as objects of play because of the power of habitual tendencies.

original: chos nyid rang bzhin mi snang ba ni sa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid rang bzhin mi snang ba ni sa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The non-appearance of the nature of reality is the fourth stage.

original: thos dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung sbyor ba sngon 'gro'i shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: thos dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung sbyor ba sngon 'gro'i shes rab pha rol phyin //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation is the preliminary practice.

original: dri med nam mkha' lta bur gyur pa'i dngos bzhi de ltar bdag gis bshad pa las /
analyzed: dri med nam mkha' lta bur gyur pa'i dngos bzhi de ltar bdag gis bshad pa las /
translated: Thus, I have explained the four things that are like the stainless sky.

original: thob pa'i dge ba gang yin de yis bdag ni bde gshegs go 'phang thob gyur nas //
